s.text: Our approach enabled the discovery ab initio of RAR agonists displaying some activity at 50 nM with a 7% success rate.
Our approach enabled the discovery ab initio of RAR agonists displaying some activity at 50 nM with a 7% success rate.
Our approach enabled the discovery ab initio of RAR agonists displaying some activity at 50 nM with a 7% success rate.

A rapid docking procedure with flexible ligand and a grid representation of the receptor was followed by an extensive Monte Carlo energy minimization with both ligand and receptor side chains flexible (see "Materials and Methods" for details).

This report details the rapid discovery of RAR agonists with novel structural features, thanks to a powerful virtual ligand screening approach, and a research strategy where considerations on existing ligands are avoided.

This rapid docking procedure was followed by a more refined energy minimization of the complex, with a full atom representation of the receptor, and flexible receptor side chains, according to the ICM stochastic global optimization algorithm [ 26, 27] as implemented in the Molsoft ICM 2.7 program [ 17].

A rapid docking procedure with flexible ligand and a grid representation of the receptor was followed by an extensive Monte Carlo energy minimization with both ligand and receptor side chains flexible (see "Materials and Methods" for details).

This report details the rapid discovery of RAR agonists with novel structural features, thanks to a powerful virtual ligand screening approach, and a research strategy where considerations on existing ligands are avoided.

This rapid docking procedure was followed by a more refined energy minimization of the complex, with a full atom representation of the receptor, and flexible receptor side chains, according to the ICM stochastic global optimization algorithm [ 26, 27] as implemented in the Molsoft ICM 2.7 program [ 17].
A high throughput virtual screening was carried out on the Available Chemicals Directory (MDL Information Systems, San Leandro, CA), a compound structure database of over 150,000 molecules.

HeLa cells were transfected by calcium phosphate precipitation using 1 ?g of plasmid expressing the full length receptor isoform and 1 ?g of a ?MTV-IR-CAT reporter gene, as previously described [ 22, 23].
At 20 ?M, agonist 1 induced full activation of RAR-? and RAR-?, and 80% activation of RAR-?, showing that this compound is a full agonist.
An increasing amount of data suggests that the RAR-? isoform, which is under the transcriptional control of RAR-?, is involved in suppressing cell growth and tumorigenicity [ 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16].

The flexible ligand was docked into a combination of five potential map representations of the RAR-? ligand binding pocket, which account for two Van der Waals boundaries, hydrophobicity, electrostatics and hydrogen bonding profiles [ 20, 27].

The procedure followed was similar than previously described [ 8]: each flexible ligand of the Available Chemicals Directory (MDL Information Systems, San Leandro) was docked automatically into the combination of potential maps described above, and assigned a score according to its fit with the receptor.
Several retinoid and non-retinoid ligands have been described, which activate one or a combination of RAR isoforms.
Several retinoid and non-retinoid ligands have been described, which activate one or a combination of RAR isoforms.
